intro: Leucophae nutans, commonly known as the drooping white-leafed heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in winter. Its leaves are leathery and often have a whitish underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
